verses.verse: When you sit <WH3427> to eat <WH3898> with a ruler <WH4910>, consider <WH995> diligently <WH995> what is before you <WH6440>:
And put <WH7760> a knife <WH7915> to your throat <WH3930>, if you be a man given <WH1167> to appetite <WH5315>.
Be not desirous <WH183> of his dainties <WH4303>: for they are deceitful <WH3577> food <WH3899>.
Labor <WH3021> not to be rich <WH6238>: cease <WH2308> from your own wisdom <WH998>.

Will you set <WH5774> your eyes <WH5869> upon that which is not <WH6213>? for riches certainly make <WH6213> themselves wings <WH3671>; they fly away <WH5774> as a eagle <WH5404> toward heaven <WH8064>.
Eat <WH3898> you not the bread <WH3899> of him that has a evil <WH7451> eye <WH5869>, neither desire <WH183> you his dainty meats <WH4303>:
For as he thinks <WH8176> in his heart <WH5315>, so is he <WH398>: Eat and drink <WH8354>, says <WH559> he to you <WH3820>; but his heart is not with you.
The morsel <WH6595> which you have eaten <WH398> shall you vomit up <WH6958>, and lose <WH7843> your sweet <WH5273> words <WH1697>.
Speak <WH1696> not in the ears <WH241> of a fool <WH3684>: for he will despise <WH936> the wisdom <WH7922> of your words <WH4405>.
Remove <WH5253> not the old <WH5769> landmark <WH1366>; and enter <WH935> not into the fields <WH7704> of the fatherless <WH3490>:
For their redeemer <WH1350> is mighty <WH2389>; he shall plead <WH7378> their cause with you <WH7379>.
Apply <WH935> your heart <WH3820> unto instruction <WH4148>, and your ears <WH241> to the words <WH561> of knowledge <WH1847>.
Withhold <WH4513> not correction <WH4148> from the child <WH5288>: for if you beat <WH5221> him with the rod <WH7626>, he shall not die <WH4191>.
You shall beat <WH5221> him with the rod <WH7626>, and shall deliver <WH5337> his soul <WH5315> from hell <WH7585>.
My son <WH1121>, if your heart <WH3820> be wise <WH2449>, my heart <WH3820> shall rejoice <WH8055>, even mine <WH589>.
Yes <WH3629>, my mind shall rejoice <WH5937>, when your lips <WH8193> speak <WH1696> right things <WH4339>.
Let not your heart <WH3820> envy <WH7065> sinners <WH2400>: but be you in the fear <WH3374> of the Lord <WH3068> all the day long <WH3117>.
For surely there is <WH3426> a end <WH319>; and your expectation <WH8615> shall not be cut off <WH3772>.
Hear <WH8085> you <WH1121>, my son, and be wise <WH2449>, and guide <WH833> your heart <WH3820> in the way <WH1870>.
Be not among winebibbers <WH3196>; among riotous eaters <WH2151> of flesh <WH1320>:
For the drunkard <WH5433> and the glutton <WH2151> shall come to poverty <WH3423>: and drowsiness <WH5124> shall clothe <WH3847> a man with rags <WH7168>.
Listen <WH8085> unto your father <WH1> that fathered <WH3205> you <WH936>, and despise not your mother <WH517> when she is old <WH2204>.
Buy <WH7069> the truth <WH571>, and sell <WH4376> it not <WH2451>; also wisdom, and instruction <WH4148>, and understanding <WH998>.
The father <WH1> of the righteous <WH6662> shall greatly <WH1524> rejoice <WH1523>: and he that fathers <WH3205> a wise <WH2450> child shall have joy of him <WH8055>.
Your father <WH1> and your mother <WH517> shall be glad <WH8055>, and she that bore <WH3205> you shall rejoice <WH1523>.
My son <WH1121>, give <WH5414> me your heart <WH3820>, and let your eyes <WH5869> observe <WH7521> my ways <WH1870>.
For a whore <WH2181> is a deep <WH6013> ditch <WH7745>; and a strange woman <WH5237> is a narrow <WH6862> pit <WH875>.
She also lies in wait <WH693> as for a prey <WH2863>, and increases <WH3254> the transgressors <WH898> among men <WH120>.
Who has woe <WH188>? who has sorrow <WH17>? who has contentions <WH4079>? who has complaints <WH7879>? who has wounds <WH6482> without cause <WH2600>? who has redness <WH2448> of eyes <WH5869>?
They that stay long <WH309> at the wine <WH3196>; they that go <WH935> to seek <WH2713> mixed wine <WH4469>.
Look <WH7200> not you upon the wine <WH3196> when it is red <WH119>, when it gives <WH5414> his colour <WH5869> in the cup <WH3563>, when it goes <WH1980> down smoothly <WH4339>.
At the last <WH319> it bites <WH5391> like a serpent <WH5175>, and stings <WH6567> like a adder <WH6848>.
Your eyes <WH5869> shall behold <WH7200> strange women <WH2114>, and your heart <WH3820> shall utter <WH1696> perverse things <WH8419>.
Yes <WH7901>, you shall be as he that lies down in the middle <WH3820> of the sea <WH3220>, or as he that lies <WH7901> upon the top <WH7218> of a mast <WH2260>.

They have stricken <WH5221> me <WH2470>, shall you say, and I was not sick; they have beaten <WH1986> me <WH3045>, and I felt it not <WH6974>: when shall I awake? I will seek <WH1245> it yet again <WH3254>.
